definition: to fix/to settle/a libation to the dead

sentences.english: Prof, Zhu Kezhcn is both a pioneer and a founder of modern geography in China.
sentences.chinese: 竺可楨教授是中國近代科學地理學的先驅與奠基人。

sentences.english: He was the founder of North Korea.
Luxun and Hushi are explorer and founder of Chinese modem literature.
sentences.chinese: 魯迅與胡適是新文學的開創者與奠基人。

sentences.english: Robespierre was the founder of French democratic politics and of virtue.
sentences.chinese: 羅伯斯比爾是法國民主政治的奠基人和關德的締造者。

sentences.english: Who is the founder of the scientific socialism?
sentences.chinese: 誰是社會主義的奠基人。

sentences.english: Ding Wenjiang was an initiator and one of the modern founders of China's geological cause.
sentences.chinese: 丁文江是我國近代地質事業的開創者和奠基人之一。

sentences.english: In memory of the founder of Chinese modern botany Prof. C. S.
sentences.chinese: 紀念我國植物學的奠基人錢崇澍教授誕辰一百週年。

sentences.english: Confucius is the founder of Confucian musical ideology.
sentences.chinese: 孔子是儒家禮樂思想的奠基人。

sentences.english: Greek philosopher, a prototype of the Cynics.
sentences.chinese: 希臘哲學家，犬儒學派奠基人之一。

sentences.english: Professor Yang Chengzong is one of the founders of radiochemistry in China.
sentences.chinese: 楊承宗教授是我國放射化學的奠基人。

sentences.english: Xiaoyuan Li is one of the founder of China's modern library career.
sentences.chinese: 李小緣先生是我國現代圖書館事業的奠基人之一。

sentences.english: Wang would be the pioneer or founder of the theory of feelings.
sentences.chinese: 王昌齡稱得上“意境”論的先驅者或奠基人。

sentences.english: He was the founder of agricultural chemistry and the discoverer of chloroform.
sentences.chinese: 他是農業化學的奠基人，氯仿的發現者。

sentences.english: Prof. Pei Wenzhong (1904-1982) was one of the pioneers and founders of prehistoric archaeology in China.
sentences.chinese: 裴文中教授是中國史前考古學的開拓者和奠基人。

sentences.english: Today Einstein is regarded as the architect of the Nuclear Age.
sentences.chinese: 今天，愛因斯坦被尊稱爲原子時代的奠基人。

sentences.english: Luxun and Hushi are explorer and founder of Chinese modern literature.
sentences.chinese: 魯迅與胡適是新文學的開創者與奠基人。

definition: representative individual (of a school of thought)
(abbr. for 泰山北斗[Tai4 Shan1 Bei3 dou3]) distinguished figure/doyen/revered authority
